definition: to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to repeat/to double/to overlap/complex (not simple)/compound/composite/double/diplo-/duplicate/overlapping/to duplicate
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
old variant of 蘇|苏[su1]
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
see 囉囌|啰苏[luo1 su1]
variant of 蘇|苏[su1]/to revive
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR)

sentences.english: On the grounds of modern emergency medicine, defibrillation has to be performed in combination with CPR.
sentences.chinese: 根据现代急救理念，电除颤必须与心肺复苏联合应用。

sentences.english: To assess the effectiveness of cardiac compressions during adult cardiopulmonary resuscitation, the nurse should palpate which pulse site?
sentences.chinese: 心肺复苏时，评估按压的有效性，应检查哪处的脉搏？

sentences.english: The cells were passaged by mechanical methods, frozen and thawed by general procedure.
sentences.chinese: 采用机械方法传代，常规方法冻存和复苏。

sentences.english: S. demand for foreign goods will rebound with the economy.
sentences.chinese: 随着经济的复苏，美国对外国产品的需求也会反弹。

sentences.english: Still, a recovery strategy dependent on reinflating an asset bubble is fraught with risks.
sentences.chinese: 不过，依靠再次创造资产泡沫的复苏策略充满了风险。

sentences.english: B. The stock market shows signs of recovery.
sentences.chinese: 股市显示出复苏的迹象。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the control system of a novel double-pump resuscitation(DPR) instrument.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍一种新型双泵复苏装置的控制系统。

sentences.english: I don't see a double dip... The recovery is on track.
sentences.chinese: 我不觉得是双谷衰退，经济复苏已经走上正轨。

sentences.english: However, the pace and timing of the recovery is still highly uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 然而，复苏的速度和时间仍然是十分不确定的。

sentences.english: Resuscitating an 89-year-old woman was difficult but well worth it.
sentences.chinese: 使89岁的老妇复苏艰难，但非常值得。

sentences.english: They also saw the need to explore new options for energizing the rebound.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到了为深化经济复苏探索新方法的需要。

sentences.english: The spring snow melt, all things recovery, 10000 Purple Yan-hong, to give hope.
sentences.chinese: 春天冰雪融化，万物复苏，万紫嫣红，给人们希望。

sentences.english: Such a frugal mind-set could take the edge off any recovery.
sentences.chinese: 而这样的节约心态将会减弱复苏进度。

sentences.english: Spring rains and warm sunlight quickened the earth.
sentences.chinese: 春雨和温暖的阳光使大地复苏了。

sentences.english: Banks need to be recapitalized for the recovery process to begin.
sentences.chinese: 银行要重新注资，以启动复苏进程。

sentences.english: Yet it is hard to believe that economic recovery and the debate over political reform cannot continue on parallel tracks.
sentences.chinese: 然而，政制改革和经济复苏是可以同时进行的。

definition: (of the weather) to warm up again
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
tired and feeble
power/momentum/tendency/impetus/situation/the look of things
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
mark/indication/sign/indicator
strong/powerful/robust
to grow/to increase
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to speed up/to accelerate/growth rate (economics)
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
appearance/to appear
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
